text: when I moved to the Biotech Industry I
came from consumer electronics which is
very different the need for industry
specific knowledge is even more
demanding at this level when I first
joined the company I sort of absorbed
everything organically so I would take
copious notes and then I would go home
and I would research it on my own time
and I really wanted to have a fuller
understanding and my vice president of
Market Dev recommended the Stanford
course and I found that it aligned well
with not just my personal needs but also
my company needs and so I signed up
right away it's just extremely flexible
and autonomous so I can take the courses
at my own time and my own speed there's
flexibility in choosing the electives
that would align best with not only what
I wanted to learn but what I needed to
have for my job the program enabled me
to tap into the Zeitgeist of not just my
company but the industry not really
having them back background in genomics
and genetics the confidence that I have
now to engage with a medical or science
expert now I can have those serious
conversations and that led into um
supporting one of the company's biggest
brand efforts with experts globally
myself and three other folks worked on
this storytelling 4-day Conference of
global genomics was an exciting way for
me to be able to stretch those skills I
learned in this course because I could
now speak their language and really
understand what's important and what's
what's driving the industry at this time
